metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Learn how to create a slider that compares two images.
content.html: Learn how to create a slider that compares two images.

content.text: Move the blue slider to compare images:
content.html: Move the blue slider to compare images:

content.code_html:
<div class="img-comp-container">
  <div class="img-comp-img">
    <img src="img_snow.jpg" width="300" height="200">
  </div>
  <div class="img-comp-img img-comp-overlay">
    <img src="img_forest.jpg" width="300" height="200">
  </div>
</div>

content.text: The container must have a "relative" positioning.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
position: 
  relative;  height: 200px; /*should be the same height as the images*/
/*should be the same height as the images*/

position: absolute;  width: auto;  
  height: auto;  overflow: hidden;

position: 
  relative;  height: 200px; /*should be the same height as the images*/
/*should be the same height as the images*/

position: absolute;  width: auto;

content.code_html:
* {box-sizing: border-box;}

.img-comp-container {
  position: relative;
  height: 200px; /*should be the same height as the images*/
}

.img-comp-img {
  position: absolute;
  width: auto;
  height: auto;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.img-comp-img img {
  display: block;
  vertical-align: middle;
}

.img-comp-slider {
  position: absolute;
  z-index: 9;
  cursor: ew-resize;
  /*set the appearance of the slider:*/
  width: 40px;
  height: 40px;
  background-color: #2196F3;
  opacity: 0.7;
  border-radius: 50%;
}

syntax_highlighting.text:
/* Find all elements 
  with an "overlay" class: */

/* Get the width and 
  height of the img element */

/* Set the width of the img element 
  to 50%: */
/* Position the slider in the middle: */

/* And another function when the mouse 
  button is released: */

/* Prevent any other 
  actions that may occur when moving over the image: */

/* The slider is now 
  clicked and ready to move: */
/* Execute a function when the slider is moved: */

/* The slider is no 
  longer clicked: */

/* If the slider is no longer 
  clicked, exit this function: */
/* Prevent the slider from being positioned outside the image: */

/* Execute a function that will resize the overlay image according to the 
  cursor: */
/* Get the x positions of the image: */

/* Calculate the 
  cursor's x coordinate, relative to the image: */

content.code_html:
function initComparisons() {
  var x, i;
  /* Find all elements with an "overlay" class: */
  x = document.getElementsByClassName("img-comp-overlay");
  for (i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
    /* Once for each "overlay" element:
    pass the "overlay" element as a parameter when executing the compareImages function: */
    compareImages(x[i]);
  }
  function compareImages(img) {
    var slider, img, clicked = 0, w, h;
    /* Get the width and height of the img element */
    w = img.offsetWidth;
    h = img.offsetHeight;
    /* Set the width of the img element to 50%: */
    img.style.width = (w / 2) + "px";
    /* Create slider: */
    slider = document.createElement("DIV");
    slider.setAttribute("class", "img-comp-slider");
    /* Insert slider */
    img.parentElement.insertBefore(slider, img);
    /* Position the slider in the middle: */
    slider.style.top = (h / 2) - (slider.offsetHeight / 2) + "px";
    slider.style.left = (w / 2) - (slider.offsetWidth / 2) + "px";
    /* Execute a function when the mouse button is pressed: */
    slider.addEventListener("mousedown", slideReady);
    /* And another function when the mouse button is released: */
    window.addEventListener("mouseup", slideFinish);
    /* Or touched (for touch screens: */
    slider.addEventListener("touchstart", slideReady);
     /* And released (for touch screens: */
    window.addEventListener("touchend", slideFinish);
    function slideReady(e) {
      /* Prevent any other actions that may occur when moving over the image: */
      e.preventDefault();
      /* The slider is now clicked and ready to move: */
      clicked = 1;
      /* Execute a function when the slider is moved: */
      window.addEventListener("mousemove", slideMove);
      window.addEventListener("touchmove", slideMove);
    }
    function slideFinish() {
      /* The slider is no longer clicked: */
      clicked = 0;
    }
    function slideMove(e) {
      var pos;
      /* If the slider is no longer clicked, exit this function: */
      if (clicked == 0) return false;
      /* Get the cursor's x position: */
      pos = getCursorPos(e)
      /* Prevent the slider from being positioned outside the image: */
      if (pos < 0) pos = 0;
      if (pos > w) pos = w;
      /* Execute a function that will resize the overlay image according to the cursor: */
      slide(pos);
    }
    function getCursorPos(e) {
      var a, x = 0;
      e = (e.changedTouches) ? e.changedTouches[0] : e;
      /* Get the x positions of the image: */
      a = img.getBoundingClientRect();
      /* Calculate the cursor's x coordinate, relative to the image: */
      x = e.pageX - a.left;
      /* Consider any page scrolling: */
      x = x - window.pageXOffset;
      return x;
    }
    function slide(x) {
      /* Resize the image: */
      img.style.width = x + "px";
      /* Position the slider: */
      slider.style.left = img.offsetWidth - (slider.offsetWidth / 2) + "px";
    }
  }
}

</script>
